newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia, Bosnia railways sign cooperation deal.
newsitem.headline: Croatia, Bosnia railways sign cooperation deal.

text.p: Croatian and Bosnian state railways signed a deal on Wednesday on technical and business cooperation that would help restore land-locked Bosnia's vital links with the Adriatic.
State news agency HINA said the delegations discussed the reopening of two railroads, one going from north-west Bosnia to Split and the other linking capital Sarajevo with the Adriatic port of Ploce.
Croatia has agreed to allow Bosnia to use Ploce as its main seaport and has turned it into a free-trade zone.
Reconstrucion of only one segment of the Sarajevo-Ploce railroad would require up to 40 million German marks, the agency said.
The route should be operational for cargo traffic by next January, it said.
